title: The First Half Of ‘BoJack Horseman’ S6 Hits Netflix Today, So There’s Tonight Sorted
text:
Have a busy weekend ahead? Lots planned? Heaps to do? Well, sorry to break it to you but you’re going to have to cancel everything, because the new season of BoJack fucking Horseman hits Netflix today – well half of it, anyway.

The 6th and final season of BoJack Horseman will be split into two parts – the first 8 episodes arriving on this very day and the final 8 episodes blessing us with their presence on January 31. So, in many respects, this first instalment is the beginning of the end. I’M FINE. *Pauses to grab tissues*

Season 6 starts with BoJack (Will Arnett) in rehab for substance abuse – for those Forgetful Felicias, season 5 ended with BoJack preparing to check into the clinic.

In the trailer, BoJack writes a letter to Diane Nguyen (Alison Brie), touching on regret, expectation and his hopes for the future. “I wasted so many years being miserable because I assumed that was the only way to be,” he writes, “and I don’t want to do that anymore.” Does this signal potential growth for our troubled Horseman?

The trailer has people feeling a lot of feelings.

“BoJack is ending, and everything is worse now,” YouTube user

“Jesus christ give this horse a freaking healthy life already I can’t do this anymore,” justdrawmano added. I feel that.

Check out the season 6 trailer below, and prepare to start swimming in those feels again.
description: The first half of 'BoJack Horseman' season 6 drops on Netflix Australia today, signalling the beginning of the show's end.
